Studies on dispersal mechanisms of plant pathogens
column2: interactions between environment factors, pathogens and plants
column3: novel methods of monitoring airborne inoculum
column4: airborne biological particles and human health.  The main aims are to investigate the  role of inoculum dispersal and environmental factors in the development of plant disease epidemics.  Current work focuses on pathogens of oilseed crops, particularly Sclerotinia sclerotiorum.  Novel techniques for detecting airborne biological particles are being investigated including molecular and immunological methods.
